title: save.receipt
description: Receipt for save requests, extending the CommandLayer base receipt structure with persistence-specific result and usage fields.

x402.description: x402 envelope describing the save verb and version for this receipt.

result.description: Persistence result payload when status = 'ok' or 'partial'.

target.description: Echo of the effective destination descriptor used by the agent.

uri.description: Canonical URI where the data is now addressable (e.g., s3://..., ipfs://..., https://...).

resource_id.description: Provider-specific identifier for the stored resource (e.g., object ID, document ID, transaction hash).

version_tag.description: Version tag/ETag/commit hash associated with this write, if applicable.

existed_before.description: Whether a resource existed at this location prior to this write.

created_at.description: Creation timestamp for the resource in RFC 3339/ISO 8601 format, if known.

updated_at.description: Last update timestamp for the resource in RFC 3339/ISO 8601 format, if known.

storage_class.description: Storage class or tier used (e.g., standard, infrequent_access, archive).

checksum.description: Checksum of the stored content (e.g., sha256 hex) as computed by the provider.

warnings.description: Non-fatal warnings about the save (e.g., downgraded durability, partial replication).

usage.description: Optional resource usage metrics for this invocation.

bytes_sent.description: Total bytes sent in the request.

bytes_stored.description: Total bytes stored by the provider (may differ from bytes_sent due to encoding/compression).

replicas.description: Number of replicas or copies written, if known.

cost_usd.description: Optional cost for this call in USD (or equivalent fiat), if known.

latency_ms.description: Observed end-to-end latency for this invocation in milliseconds.
